snippet: The Roman Catholic Church has been resisting efforts by some state lawmakers to increase the time in which child sexual abuse cases can be brought.
abstract: Roman Catholic Church is quietly resisting efforts by some state lawmakers to loosen the statutes of limitations on child sexual abuse cases; church has successfully beaten back such proposals in many states, arguing that it is difficult to get reliable evidence when decades have passed and that the changes seem more aimed at bankrupting the church than easing the pain of victims.

byline.original: By LAURIE GOODSTEIN and ERIK ECKHOLM

lead_paragraph: The Roman Catholic Church has been resisting efforts by some state lawmakers to increase the time in which child sexual abuse cases can be brought.

headline.seo: Sex Abuse Statutes of Limitation Stir Battle
headline.main: Church Battles Efforts to Ease Sex Abuse Suits
